job_title: Senior Admission Counselor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Incredibly supportive and passionate staff, I was really inspired by their dedication. The school also really walks the talk, and instead of laying off tons of people during the pandemic they had a robust donation campaign. Even the president donated, which helped morale.
cons: Not as much room to grow and less tracks for employee development.

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Los Angeles, CA

job_title: Creative Role in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The role I have at this institution is rewarding and fulfilling in my life. I work in a creative role at this institution and am given a lot of latitude to take creative risks. The team I work with is supportive and there is a lot of room and support for career development. A lot of other nonprofits and higher education institutions claim to take action for DEI initiatives without actually implementing change. Otis is a place that actually takes action and creates DEI initiatives for both students and staff. Also, an individual's critical thoughts or ideas are considered here. There is room for healthy, mature, contrarian conversations. This place is growing and it's exciting to be a part of the growth.
cons: There are some old hats that are slow to change which sometimes stagnates progress.

job_title: Digital Media Administrative Aid in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Allows student to interact and meet other Digital Media faculty such as the chairs of the department
cons: Mostly worked alone in this position so if you prefer working with others regularly, this position may not be for you

job_title: Administrative Aide in Los Angeles, CA

job_title: Program Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Everyone who works here cares deeply about the students and the community, from part time assistants up to the senior team. They have regular town halls for all faculty/staff and solicit community input for any senior-level hires, so it really feels like all employees are able to be stake-holders in the college as a whole. Also, because the college is small there's generally more flexibility within any given role, which also means more opportunities to make unique and meaningful contributions to the college as a whole. Work/life balance seems good, but also varies a lot depending within each department. Great benefits, great people, very fulfilling.
cons: Salaries are low compared to other higher-education institutions and very low for the area. If you are in a entry to mid-level position you will definitely need to find roommates in order to make rent. Unfortunately I don't see this changing anytime soon - the high student-to-faculty ratio means high labor costs even when paying below market rates and no one wants a pay increase if it has to be put on the student's backs.

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I worked at Otis a number of years ago as an admissions counselor. I enjoyed the culture of the school, the students, my colleagues, and the flexibility. I worked at Otis quite a while ago so I can not speak to the culture at this moment.
cons: The salary at Otis for an AC was low.

review_title: Get the Most out of this Experience.
job_title: Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: A wealth of knowledge at bay, so attend private free events, network and utilize available resources such as their amazing library and website's reference tools.  Friendly, brilliant, talented and special student and professional minds.
cons: Management creates super high expectations that are more or less not to be achieved.  Student work is a direct reflect of their engagement in their course and available guidelines.  Some student work is farmed out last minute due to students' lack there of preparation.  Course work could be perked up / modernized as relevant to student and industry interest / standards.  Make sure to check your hours against paycheck.  Payroll can get confused and underpay.

job_title: Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Benefits, PTO, 2-week PAID Winter Break
cons:
POOR Senior Team Management. Unorganized and Messy Leadership, Favoritism

HONESTLY, how is it that people have worked here for 4+ years and no raise, no promotion, NOTHING. That definitely has to change. Reward employees for doing good work. The VP has NO IDEA what they're doing. Train leaders the proper way so the whole team doesn't suffer and get affected by bad leadership.

This school may look good on the outside, but on the inside, it's a MESS. Poor students have to deal with it.

review_title: Otis; small town feel, innovative arts environment.
job_title: Director in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Working in an innovative educational arts environment with creative people.  Otis has a competitive benefits package with excellent paid leave for holidays due to the academic schedule.  The small school environment means you will know everyone in each department which results in an extended family feel in the workplace.
cons: Small endowment means big projects are not easy to fund.  Higher education salaries tend to be lower than corporate and there is not a lot of upward mobility due to the shallow hierarchical structure.

job_title: Student Worker in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The working environment here is very conducive as it works around your classes. You make your own schedule. You are also allowed some sick days which is also very beneficial so you are not pressured to overwork yourself in order t make an extra buck.
cons: For a student you can only work for a maximum of 20 hours a week which is good when you have a tight schedule but if you have more free time it would be good to be able to earn from more hours.

job_title: in Temple City, CA
pros: This was a fun school, met a lot of great people! The classes taught SO much in just one semester. It was a great school to learn about my future career; fashion. The mentor projects were demanding but always worth it in the end.
cons: This school has very VERY rigorous courses. One really has to test themselves and always try their best in order to get the most out of the classes. Deadlines are crazy here! Never procrastinate.

job_title: Administrator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Creative, on-going in-house training, flexible schedule for some things, responsive to addressing issues, wonderful community, very cool events and network
cons: Salaries are low. If you don't have a roommate or living partner, it's hard to make a living and live in LA comfortably

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Otis provides a great opportunity to work in a creative environment with talented and committed people -- students, faculty, administration, and leadership.
cons: As a smaller institution Otis has limited financial resources. However, the College's can-do culture enables it to do more with less.

job_title: Lecturer in Los Angeles, CA
